frameDefinitions: Two or more distinct entities, which may be concrete or abstract objects or types, are characterized as being similar to each other.
An Agent removes a Theme from a Source so that the it is in the Agent's possession.
A Resisting_entity is capable of resisting or does resist a physical Opposing_force to a level specified by the target.
The Outcome of a contest is described in terms of the Margin between what would be required for victory and the actual Outcome.
An Entity has a Temperature characterized by the target.
This frame is about the static comparison of an Profiled_item to a Standard_item, often  with respect to some Attribute.
frameExamples:
A mulberry is very <t>similar</t> in shape
to a loganberry
Milton <t>took</t> the can of beer out of the refrigerator.
The great and <t>impregnable</t> fortress still stands today.
The Basque nationalists won a <t>narrow</t> victory in the regional elections on Sunday.
The pan is already too <t>hot</t> to touch.
The Sun is putting on a show that <t>rivals</t> the most sizzling Hollywood thrillers.
listRoleDefinitions: This role marks constituents that express the set of objects or types whose similarity is at issue.

When there is an asymmetry, <fen>Entity_1</fen> is the entity characterized by its similarity to <fen>Entity_2</fen>, whose characteristics are assumed to be known.  <fen>Entity_1</fen> is often an external argument.

When the <fen>Entities</fen> are expressed separately, <fen>Entity_2</fen> is the one whose characteristics are assumed to be known; it serves as a basis for establishing characteristics of <fen>Entity_1</fen>.
This role marks constituents which express a property in respect to which the similarity of the entities is assessed.
A fact about <fen>Entity_1</fen> or the <fen>Entities</fen> that reveals how <fen>Entity_1</fen> is the same or different from other entities.  (Note the contrast with 'as to'.)
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the similarity occurs or exists.
The Place is the general area in which similarity occurs or exists
The person who takes possession of the <fen>Theme</fen>.
The <fen>Agent</fen> takes possession of the <fen>Theme</fen>.
The location of the <fen>Theme</fen> prior to the taking.
When the taking takes place.
Where the taking takes place.
The <fen>Resisting_entity</fen> is the item that resists the <fen>Opposing_force</fen> to the level specified by the target.

The <fen>Opposing_force</fen> is the item placed in opposition to the <fen>Resisting_entity</fen>. <fen>Opposing_force</fen> hinders, blocks, helps, or allows (lets) the <fen>Resisting_entity</fen> to resist at the level specified by the target. Sometimes this Core role is incorporated in the target; otherwise, it is often null instantiated in example sentences.
The <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Resisting_entity</fen> resists an external force.
The location where the <fen>Resisting_entity</fen> resists an external force.
The <fen>Outcome</fen> of a contest whose <fen>Margin</fen> is under consideration.
The difference between the minimum required for victory and the actual <fen>Outcome</fen>.
A modifier expressing  the deviation of the <fen>Value</fen> from what is expected given the <fen>Outcome</fen> and the <fen>Value</fen> indicated by the target.
The generally implicit <fen>Value</fen> of the <fen>Margin</fen>.
The <fen>Entity</fen> for which the temperature <fen>Attribute</fen> is under consideration.
The feature of an <fen>Entity</fen> which is under discussion.
A quantity or other characterization of the <fen>Entity</fen>'s state with respect to the temperature <fen>Attribute</fen>.
A modifier expressing  the deviation of the <fen>Temperature</fen> from the norm.
The <fen>Time</fen> during which the <fen>Entity</fen> is in the state of having  a particular <fen>Degree</fen> for the temperature <fen>Attribute</fen>.
In active sentences, the <fen>Profiled_item</fen> is the grammatically more prominent one of the items that are compared and realized as  the subject. .
In active setnnces, the <fen>Standard_item</fen> is  the grammatically less prominent element, i.e. the object or an oblique.
This Frame Elements marks constituents that indicate in which respect Item-1 and Item-2 are equal to each other.
The <fen>Standard_attribute</fen> is used when the standard is a specific value on  a scale.
The <fen>Profiled_attribute</fen> is a particular value on a scale which is being compared to a <fen>Standard_item</fen> or <fen>Profiled_attribute</fen>.
The time at which the <fen>Profiled_item</fen> rivals the <fen>Standard_item</fen>.
The location where the <fen>Profiled_item</fen> rivals the <fen>Standard_item</fen>.
listRoleExamples: <fex>The two painters</fex> were alike in being unable to draw acceptably .
In the first phase <fex>Barthes's approach</fex> has similarities to that of Levi-Strauss.
The results of Method 2 show remarkable similarity <fex>to those obtained by Method 1</fex>
The disc announced Friday is <fex>physically</fex> similar to current music CDs
His presidency was different <fex>in that it offered a way forward for the common man</fex> .
<fex>Milton</fex> took the can of beer out of the refrigerator.
Milton took <fex>the can of beer</fex> out of the refrigerator.
Milton took the can of beer <fex>out of the refrigerator</fex>.
The government seizure of a suspected dissident's computer <fex>last November</fex> has increased the tension between citizens and law enforcement.
Police seized several tons of marijuana <fex>in Berkeley</fex> last weekend.
These are made from a tough <fex>plastic foam</fex> and are very light to wear.
The fortress was impregnable <fex>to attack by hostile invaders</fex>.
The retaining wall was even weaker <fex>yesterday</fex>, and had begun to crumble.
They decided the tree-house would be sturdiest <fex>in the big old backyard oak</fex>.
<fex>The soup</fex>'s too hot.
The skillet had a temperature <fex>of 230 F</fex>
<fex>This PC</fex> stacks up well against its competitors
This PC stacks up well <fex>against its competitors</fex>
The Tri-Cities stack up well against the competition <fex>in the area of innovation</fex>
We equalled <fex>father's skills</fex> .
American caviar <fex>now</fex> rivals Russia's in quality.
<fex>In Africa</fex>, the level of drug resistance rivals even Noatirtin's vaunted efficacy.

sourceCandidateSpans.text: the Natural Sciences and Engineering Research Council of Canada
